messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Yeah, I just...
Do you need medical aid or police assistance?
I just committed a father's worst sin.
Okay.
I just shot my daughter in the head and my son in the head.
Okay, what is your address?
I had to put them out of their misery.
Okay, where are you at, sir?
I'm going to have to shoot myself to get rid of their demons.
Okay, sir, are you armed?
I can't hear you.
I need your address, please. Sir, what is your address?
Can you hear me?
Yes.
1509 5th Street Southeast.
Okay. Do you have a weapon? Do you have the gun now?
Yes, I do.
Okay.
It's all because of alcohol and drugs. Our family's torn apart.
Okay. You mentioned your son has two little boys upstairs asleep and your wife is asleep.
Yes, they're asleep.
And you said there are children in the residence?
Yes, my son's little boys.
Okay, what's your name?
My name is Michael.
Michael, what's your last name?
Okay, Michael.
Is your son and daughter... Are they... Okay. Can you hear me?
Yes.
Okay. You said you've been drinking tonight?
No, not me. Our kids and our grandkids, the older ones, have been doing the drugs and drinking.
Okay.
Oh, my God. Jesus, for years we've been dealing with this. My wife is suffering with depression and anxiety.
Hold on one second, Michael, for me. Stay on the line. I don't want you to hang up.
Okay, Michael, what room are you in right now?
I'm sorry, I can't understand you. What room are you in right now, Mike?
I'm in the kitchen.
I'm going to have to shoot myself.
No, I'm asking you, Michael, if you can put the gun down for me?
I set the gun down.
You've set the gun down?
Yes, the gun is down.
Okay. What kind of gun do you have?
I can't take this anymore.
Michael, I need you to stay calm. What kind of gun do you have?
It's a .22 caliber.
Do you have the gun again?
No, it's sitting right here by me.
But it's set down, correct?
Yes.
Are your grandkids in the residence? Are those the two children you were talking about?
Yes, they're just little boys. They're like six and seven, sleeping upstairs with my wife.
Okay, Michael, I don't want you to harm yourself. I want you to stay on the line and talk with me, okay? We can get you some help.
Okay, my son is moaning. He has a problem. I need to do it again.
No, Michael, we're going to get you some help. You don't need to do that.
Okay.
What room is he in?
He's in the living room on the couch and my daughter is upstairs in her bedroom.
Do you have a cordless phone, Michael?
Yes, I'm on a cordless phone.
Are you still in the kitchen?
Yes, I'm in the kitchen.
I want you to stay there and keep talking with me; we're getting help to you.
Okay, I need an ambulance here.
Okay, stay on the line. The front door is unlocked, correct?
Yes, it's unlocked.
Michael, I need you to stay calm. We're going to get you some help. I want you to put the gun down and go to the front door where the officers can talk to you, okay?
I am so cold.
Michael, stay calm. Do you have a jacket you can put on?
Yes, I'm putting my jacket on.
Let me know when you've put the jacket on and are walking to the front door.
The gun is on the counter.
The gun is on the counter, that's good. Are you going to the front door now?
Yes, I'm walking to the front door now.
He's walking to the front door now. Just keep walking, Michael.
I'm shaking like a leaf.
Okay, we'll get you warm. Just keep going, you’re doing great.
I just want to die, but I can't leave my family alone.
Michael, focus on getting to the door. The police are there to help you.
Okay, I'm at the front door.
You're at the front door, good. Open the door slowly and do what the police say, okay?
I'm opening the door now.
